title: Regency Enterprises - Wikipedia
snippet: Therefore, Regency International Pictures became the holding company for all Milchan’s investments and was legally renamed as Regency Enterprises (doing business as Arnon Milchan Enterprises) and two new companies (both 100% held by Regency Enterprises) were established to produce movies: ...

title: Regency Enterprises - Audiovisual Identity Database
snippet: Regency Enterprises is an American film production company formed in 1991 as a joint venture between Arnon Milchan, Scriba & Deyle and Canal+ to finance 20 films in five years, with New Regency Productions acting as its production and sales arm.

title: Regency Enterprises | Corus Entertainment Fandom | Fandom
snippet: Regency Enterprises (commonly referred to as Regency onscreen and credited as Monarchy Enterprises S.á.r.l.) is an American entertainment company formed by Arnon Milchan. It was founded in 1991 as the successor to Regency International Pictures ...

title: Regency Enterprises (Creator) - TV Tropes
snippet: It was founded in 1991 as the successor to Regency International Pictures formerly known as Embassy International Pictures N.V. Arnon Milchan rebranded Regency International Pictures and renamed it to Regency Enterprises.

title: Regency Enterprises | Golden
snippet: Regency Enterprises is a privately held company involved in the video production industry and founded on January 1, 1982 by Arnon Milchan and Joseph Patrick Grace.
